thread.title: Obama will go to Roseburg Friday to meet with families of Umpqua shooting victims
thread.title_full: Obama will go to Roseburg Friday to meet with families of Umpqua shooting victims | OregonLive.com

author: Jeff Mapes | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Obama will go to Roseburg Friday to meet with families of Umpqua shooting victims
text:
President Barack Obama will visit Roseburg Friday, marking yet another stop he has made in a community hit by a mass shooting.
Obama will "visit privately with families of victims," according to a White House official, who said further details of his visit would be released in the next few days.
 The president has already been scheduled to attend a luncheon fundraiser that day in Seattle for Sen. Patty Murray, D-Wash., so he's presumably coming to Roseburg before or after.
Obama spoke at length about the shooting on Thursday, just hours after a gunman killed nine and injured nine before killing himself, and returned to the subject during a Friday press conference.
In both cases, Obama said it was not enough to offer condolences and said he would continue to press Congress to "enact common-sense gun legislation."
In recent years, Obama has also consoled victims of mass shootings in Charleston, S.C., Aurora, Colo., and Newtown, Conn.
--Jeff Mapes
jmapes@oregonian.com
